footer.footnote-text: Music Paradigm is an open source platform developped for managing remote mutiusers musical training experiments.

pre-session-advice.close-all: Please close all other applications and webpages before continuing.
pre-session-advice.web-browser: Make sure you are using the Google Chrome web browser.

attach-piano.attach-piano:
Please attach the MIDI-keyboard to your computer using the USB-chord and place it so you can play it comfortably.

When done, press the button below

test-piano.verify-piano:
The piano is now muted: you will not hear any sound.
Verify that the keys indicated on dislay mirror the keys you press.
test-piano.press-any-key: Press any key on the MIDI Keyboard
test-piano.problem-signal: Nothing happens when I press any key?
test-piano.problem-correspondance: The keys highlighted do not correspond to the key I press?

test-sound.verify-sound:
You should now hear a piano sound.

Please Adjust the volume to a confortable level.

default.title: Unspecified
default.conclusion:
If the solution above did not fix the problem:
 Please contact the operator of the platform for further technical support. | If the solutions above did not fix the problem:
 Please contact the operator of the platform for further technical support.

piano-setting.title: MIDI keyboard not reachable
piano-setting.solution-1: Make sure you are using the Google Chrome web browser. Other web browsers as Firefox and Internet Explorer are not compatible with the MIDI keyboard.

piano-input.title: No MIDI input received
piano-input.solution-1:
Try uplugging and replugging the keyboard.
Press the OK buton to restart the MIDI keyboard initialization.

piano-correspondance.title: Not corresponding notes
piano-correspondance.solution-1:
The MIDI keyboard has two buttons labelled 'octave'.
Use those buttons until the keys you press on your MIDI keyboard correspond to the keys displayed.

piano-sound.title: No sound heard
piano-sound.solution-1: Verify the volume (it might be too low or muted).
piano-sound.solution-2: Refresh the page and try again.
piano-sound.solution-3: Close this window and retry on a now page.
piano-sound.solution-4: Restart the device and try again.
piano-sound.conclusion:
If the solution(s) above did not fix the problem:
It is likely that there is a problem with the sound of your computer.
Please contact the operator of the platform for further technical support.

speed.footnote-start-after-press: The time limit will start after the first key press
speed.footnote-after-time: The session will go to the next step in {time}

accuracy.footnote-after-performance: The session will go to the next step after your performance
accuracy.footnote-after-performance-or-time: The session will go to the next step after your performance or after {second} second | The session will go to the next step after your performance or after {second} seconds

text-timeout.default-message-top:
The time limit was reached.
The experiment ends here.

context.confirm-leave: Do you really want to leave the session in progress?

cue.footnote-no-melody: There is no melody to be played, the session will automatically  go to the next step in {second} second | There is no melody to be played, the session will automatically  go to the next step in {second} seconds
cue.footnote-after-melody: The session will automatically go to the next step after the muscial cue

end.footnote-press-any-key: Press any piano key or the space bar for ending the session
end.footnote-press-space-bar: Press the space bar for ending the session

feedback.footnote-press-any-key: Press any piano key or the space bar for going to the next step
feedback.footnote-press-space-bar: Press the space bar for going to the next step

instruction.footnote-press-any-key: Press any piano key or the space bar for going to the next step
instruction.footnote-press-space-bar: Press the space bar for going to the next step

playing.footnote-after-performance: The session will go to the next step after your performance

rest.footnote-after-time: The session will go to the next step in {time}

video.footnote-no-video: There is no video to be played, the session will automatically go to the next step in {second} second | There is no video to be played, the session will automatically go to the next step in {second} seconds
video.footnote-after-video: The experiment will automatically go to the next step after the video playback
video.no-video: There is no video to be played
